title: Synthetic Recap
body:
TORONTO (AP) — On a night when the dynasty’s engine sputtered, its soul delivered a performance for the ages. With Michael Jordan mired in an uncharacteristic shooting funk, Scottie Pippen didn't just pick up the slack; he authored a masterpiece, carrying the Chicago Bulls to a gritty 96-83 victory over the Toronto Raptors.

The stat sheet tells a story of sheer, unadulterated dominance: 42 points, a staggering 17 rebounds, 8 assists, 4 steals, and 3 blocks. But the numbers fail to capture the sheer will Pippen displayed. With Jordan struggling to find his rhythm, Pippen became the offensive focal point, the defensive quarterback, and the emotional leader all at once. He was everywhere, a 6-foot-8 force of nature imposing his will on both ends of the floor.

His historic line—a hair's breadth from a 40-point triple-double while anchoring a championship-level defense—was a reminder that for all the talk of his legendary teammate, Pippen was a Hall of Famer in his own right. He attacked the rim, hit from the perimeter, and orchestrated the offense with a maestro's touch.

While Pippen’s tour de force rightfully stole the spotlight, Dennis Rodman corralled 19 rebounds and Luc Longley added 14 points to provide crucial support. But this was Pippen’s night, a stunning individual effort that underscored the depth and resilience of the Bulls. On a night they could have faltered, one of their pillars stood tallest, delivering a performance that was more than just a win—it was a testament to his immortal place in basketball history.
